tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: We search on behalf of Peter Gunn, a man who has struggled to come to terms with his birth mother giving him up for adoption. And a man desperately searching for the sister who disappeared from his life over 60 years ago.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Tino Carnevale helps build a veterans garden; Jane Edmanson discovers the commemorative power of poppies; Costa Georgiadis gets cooking with chef Ben Shewry; and Sophie Thomson sees a pool transformed to a pond.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: This week on The Pacific we dive into the regions enduring love of beauty pageants. Amid the glamour, we also explore the tensions and debates shaping the future of pageantry in the Pacific. (Season Final)

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Following a cancer diagnosis, Gary and Lorilie set out to build a multi-million dollar multigenerational family home.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: We meet one woman searching for her sister, hoping to discover the truth behind a family tragedy and another woman desperate to find the only person in the world that she knows she is related to, her mother.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Grand Country Garden and Urban Design
programme.desc: Tammy explores a visionary country garden in full bloom, Sophie shares shade plant tips, Jane visits a garden rich in horticultural history, Josh discovers a biodiverse verge, and we meet a world-renowned landscape designer.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Tom Gleeson and his Big Brass Mug are besieged by another four contestants with eclectic expert subjects: lawn bowls lover Andrew, hyaenas expert Alex, Aunty Donna fan Geordie, and Jye, whos really into The O.C.!

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Renowned interviewer, Leigh Sales mentors Autistic journalism students as the interview Australian sporting legend Steve Waugh, with hilarious results.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: An abandoned lorry containing multiple dead bodies reveals a shocking trafficking case.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits, and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going every Saturday morning with wall-to-wall music videos, from classic hits and long-forgotten tracks from the rage vault, to the latest new releases and special features.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: Professor T
programme.desc: As Professor T persuades Lisa to go behind Pauls back and help him try to prove his case, he starts to shine a different light on the prosecutions evidence.

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: How did it feel to watch from the 92nd floor of the World Trade Center, as the first 9/11 plane hit the building opposite?

programme.title: Return To Paradise
programme.desc: When a radical eco-activist is murdered, Mackenzie and her team must figure out how the victim was killed when the suspects were chained together, unable to reach the victim.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: Now You Sia, Now You Dont!
programme.desc: The gang track a ghostly doppelganger that looks like Sia.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going as the sun comes up with continuous music videos, from new releases to classics and the songs weve long forgotten.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: The Baby Bears have an adventure in the sky while aboard a plane to Sweden. But when the baby Bears are forced to sit in different sections of the plane, things get a bit haywire for everyone on board.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors find themselves in a race as they explore the special bones in your feet. Meet the families awaiting the arrival of the first ever Ouch babies, and you wont believe your eyes in todays mindbending trick.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Lys sets out to find a rare creature.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Timmy accidentally eats a tomato grown with Miracle-Grow fertiliser and expands to become the King Kong of sheep. Shaun must keep the giant toddler out of sight while trying to figure out how to return him to normal size.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: BB avoids being the dumb one by making the other Titans dumber.

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This features one of the most bizarre but certainly the tallest robot ever seen on Robot Wars, Gabriel, built by Mensa member Craig and his three sons. It has wheels as tall as a washing machine and a huge samurai sword.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve heads down in a deep-sea submersible to explore the ocean depths like never before. He then travels to the Natural History Museum to meet some of the weirdest animals from the deep.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Pan Is Born! And Goku Goes On A Training Journey?!
programme.desc: Gohans precious daughter is born, and Chichi refuses to let her become a martial artist. Bulma manages to talk some sense into her and reveals where Vegeta is training, leaving Goku desperate to find a way to join them.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: The Sword, The Fox And The Scooby-doo!
programme.desc: The gang help Mark Hamill face a Fox Monster in Japan.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Duncan stages a small coup to oust Courtney as their official class firefighter so that he can wear the shiny firefighter helmet until he smells smoke in the classroom and begs her to take her job back.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand invents a facial recognition system to keep Dr Chris out of the lab, theres a brand new quiz putting the doctors on the spot in Ouchology, and find out how to lift your mood in Mindboosters.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi must free a wild creature captured by Taborr.

programme.title: Hard Quiz Kids
programme.sub-title: Australian Politics, Elephants, Toy Story and Stray Kids
programme.desc: Four young experts match wits and dodge witticisms from host Tom Gleeson with their subjects: Australian politics, elephants, the Toy Story movies, and pop group Stray Kids!

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: Janine prepares to meet her struggling students mother during open house, while the rest of the faculty uses the time to relax.

programme.title: Pokemon: Diamond And Pearl
programme.desc: In the Eterna Forest, our heroes meet a treasure hunter named Cheryl whos on a mission to discover the Amber Castle, which holds a special Enchanted Honey!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand make the most of Mr Grumbles weekly shower to demonstrate how your hair has a secret skill enabling it to measure moisture in the air.

programme.title: The Pianist
programme.desc: During WWII, pianist and composer Wladyslaw Szpilman becomes separated from his family. As the situation worsens, he must hide in the ruins of Warsaw and put his trust in a sympathetic German officer in order to survive.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand has broken the rules and snuck a marble run into the lab but will Dr Chris notice in todays blood pressure experiment?!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: To solve the mystery of a ghostly performer haunting her former venue, the Gang has to pretend to be a rock band themselves! But can they solve the case before Velma has to actually get on stage and sing?

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Devil Daniels is copying all Ants ideas. He even has his own pet fish - Bethany! The Nektons are busy recovering sunken shipping containers, so when Bethany finds herself in danger, only Jeffrey can save her!

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: After getting sucked into Jareds favorite board game, Buttercup is forced to team-up with him in order to save her sisters.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: When the gang bands together to form a giant robot.

programme.title: Pokemon: Diamond And Pearl
programme.desc: The quarterfinal round of the Sinnoh League has arrived - and Ash and Paul are ready to face off in a rematch of their 6-on-6 full battle!

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: L and friends discover that bathtime is more fun when you double up and ride your bathtub down a hill. This episode introduces the double letters LL, SS and FF and the words tub, hill, doll, bell, mess, miss, kiss and off.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil is tasked with helping Victoria and Michael shift the grand Victorian house theyve called home for the past 30 years. The property is wearing them out but the trouble is, the interior is as tired as they are.

programme.title: Mulholland Drive
programme.desc: Betty Elms has only just arrived in Hollywood to become a movie star when she meets Rita - an enigmatic brunette with amnesia. The two set off to find clues related to Ritas accident and ascertain her true identity.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: There are problems in the bedroom which threaten to drive Ben and Susan apart. Abi thinks this may be her fault but she develops her own problems as Janey becomes her personal shopper.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway?
programme.desc: Aisha Tyler hosts another episode of the legendary improv show featuring regulars Wayne Brady, Ryan Stiles and Colin Mochrie along with guest performer Jeff Davis and star guest actress and singer Tinashe.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: With the HSC exams just days away, Bolton rallies his classmates to make their Muck-Up Day an event to remember. (Final)

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Shaggy and Scoobys favourite chef is finally opening his own restaurant but a monstrous Yeti threatens the opening night.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.sub-title: At The Bottom Of The Gyre
programme.desc: A clever machine Ant created to clean up a vast oceanic rubbish dump, has been eaten by a huge creature! Can the Nektons save Ants machine, save the creature, and try to save the planet all in one day?

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Cyborg teaches the other Titans about "real" wrestling.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Ming Dynasty Astronaut / Free Energy / Killer Ceiling Fan
programme.desc: Buster takes the hot seat in the desert for the myth of the Ming Dynasty Astronaut, plus the quest for free energy and, will Adams stunt double lose its head at the hands of the killer fan?

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.sub-title: Little Nanas Quiet And Noisy Story
programme.desc: Inside the little Toy House, Little Nana and Lambkin are being very noisy. Lily Plant suggests they might like to quietly read a book, so Little Nana chooses a story all about being very quiet.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Morts delicious, icy, mollypop is missing. Dun dun dun! Who in Mollyvale ate it? Detective Pop and Beep are on the case to uncover what happened. Is there a thief on the loose? Will they get their just desserts?

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Bop promises to build a giant robot but its more difficult than he thought. Not wanting to disappoint his friends, Bop dresses up in a giant robot costume instead.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector tries to help Mole hear the stars at night by giving them a sound.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sula and Amma have come to Bings house for lunch but there are no carrots so Flop pops to the shop to get some. Bing stays behind but its not long before he starts to miss Flop. Missing Flop... its a Bing thing!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig winds the old cuckoo clock in Peppa and Georges bedroom. The clock strikes the hour and a wooden cuckoo pops out, but George wasnt looking and missed the whole thing. George does not want to miss the cuckoo again.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its time for the annual dog show and the Farmer is sure Bitzer has a good chance of winning this year. When things dont quite go as planned, the Farmer comes up with an ingenious idea which might help him win.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: While trying to rescue Luc the wild boar, Moose ends up needing a rescue himself.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Snooty King and Queen Marigold invite themselves round for dinner to King and Queen Thistles Castle to sample Nanny Plums cooking. Nanny, the best cook in the world, tries hard to cook special modern food.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family are going for a walk in the countryside and end up climbing a big hill. When they get to the top there is a wonderful view.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: While Gemma tests out her new underwater camera, Frizzy and Pounce dive headfirst into an investigation of a mysterious sea monster sighting!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Lobo and Spike learn the power of teamwork and embracing uniqueness in magical adventures filled with lessons on friendship and overcoming challenges.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Grown-Up Jobs
programme.desc: When Jay hears about Appas big day at the allotment doing grown-up jobs, he decides he wants to be a grown-up too. Nikhil helps him be just like the other grown-ups in the house.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie prepares for a visit to the dentist by learning about the special tools, what the dentist does and how to relax in the big chair.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can water travel using a piece of string? Absorb some fun facts as Michelle strings together some household items to experiment with water.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds discover some of the clever things that happen on railways! Two passenger trains become one in a faraway railway station, and then they see how freight trains move giant boxes all around the country!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig finds a spider in the house and orders Daddy Pig to get rid of it. Mr Skinny-Legs is set free in the garden, where he can spin all the webs he likes, wherever he likes.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Wallace starts shedding a lot, Millie finds a clever way to contain all the extra dog hair.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Benjamin has lost his favourite toy, Wonder Vole who helps him go to sleep at night and feel brave. Stanley helps Benjamin and Sophie look all over the house then suggests they search everywhere Benjamin had been to that day.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Owlette accidentally helps Pirate Robot attack the Flying factory.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Tobys passengers cant stop making fun of him, but they soon change their mind when he stops two villains trying to steal King Godreds Crown.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa visits a native flower farm with the kids, and they learn all about flowers and their roles in nature. They collect their faves, create flower fashion and hit the runway.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles as they explore the excitement of preschool life, from morning routines to playtime, and learn all about hygiene for clean preschool fun!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Katyas tumble off her broom makes her vow to never fly again, but with her friends support, she learns that mistakes are part of learning and regains her confidence.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny Pig places a large order of plastic gnomes and a wishing well for the garden, Peppa and George love them but Grandpa Pig is not happy. He wishes they would all disappear!

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Pharaoh Boy finds a magical stone to control cats, How will he use it to carry out his evil plan?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: The Browns come back from a beach trip with more than sand in their hair - why is that shell moving on its own?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Strange holes are appearing throughout the Little Kingdom. Its the Dwarves, deep underground, digging for treasure! A solution must be found before the Dwarves dig up everything.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Millie and the kids learn about wicking gardens and how veggies love them. They create their own wicking gardens with herbs.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.sub-title: Mr Onion And Dibillo In The Tub!
programme.desc: Inside the little Toy House, everybody is very happy to see the little toy tub. In Storyland, the great big tub visits Mr Onion and he plays a game of surprises with his best friend Dibillo.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Suns out and surfs up! Beep is excited for her first day at the beach, but sand, water and pesky seagulls? Hmm... what can a robot do at the beach? Dustin shows her theres something fun for everyone.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Everyone in Hoopla loves the dragon boat festival, especially Jango who loves it because Mimi makes delicious sticky rice dumplings. Jango sneakily eats all the dumplings and pretends that there is a hungry dragon in Hoopla.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Todays sound adventure is around bells, big and small. Mole isnt so sure...

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing has a brand new Hoppity Voosh lunch box, and Pando has the exact same one. At first its fun to match, but that changes when Bing and Pando mix their lunchboxes up and end up with the wrong lunch.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are going ice-skating today. They have never been ice skating before and Peppa keeps falling over. Daddy Pig tells her not to worry; everyone falls over when they skate for the first time.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun comes across a discarded jigsaw puzzle and calls on the Flock to help him put it together. When Bitzer discovers the final piece is missing they decide they must do whatever it takes to solve the puzzle.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Chilli decides to become a superhero called Super Chilli! His superhero skills are put to the test when Evil Pea covers Supertato in sticky honey, but Chillis heat saves the day.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: When Zoe and Isadora meet Zoes annoying cousin Max, Zoe begs Isadora to shapeshift into a kitten and pretend to be her pet in order to impress Max.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.sub-title: Once in a Blue Moon / Zombie Eyes Surprise
programme.desc: On Blue Moon night, Katya struggles to choose a punch flavor, while Zoe learns to control her powers after spoiling a game. Together, the Super Monsters embrace teamwork, fun, and friendship.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: Timmy cant wait to trick or treat as a Mecha T-Rex, but needs the Mechas help when he cant reach the arms of his costume.

programme.title: Room On The Broom
programme.desc: This magical tale about friendship and family follows a kind witch who invites a surprising collection of animals to join her on her broom. From the producers of The Gruffalo and The Gruffalos Child.

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: A bicycle ride with Dad soon turns into an intergalactic space adventure, as Maddie + Triggs imagine themselves as brave explorers, shooting like rockets into the unknown.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Odd Sock Tyler needs to replace his missing dance crew. Andy and the band put their best feet forward, with some help from Cousin Macs Super Sneakers, but its a bit more choreography chaos than dancing distinction!

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Why do some things fall faster? Were reaching new heights to find out why some items fall faster than others. Join Alex as he creates a parachute for a toy dinosaur using a serviette.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Alicia is nervous about her driving test, so Millie and the Creato-crew build a "practice car" to help her feel more confident.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When their barber goes on vacation ahead of Robotics Team picture day, the Dream Factory Crew build a grooming robot to get themselves ready for their close-up.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Enemy Anemones
programme.desc: The Octonauts and some helpless crabs are caught between two territorial groups of aggregating anemones - and their numbers are growing!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee and the squirrels play a game of Spot the Difference and youre all invited to join in!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Percy causes confusion and delay by panicking over nothing.

programme.title: Hey Duggee Songs
programme.desc: Its sing-a-long time with Duggee and the Squirrels! Sing and dance with these original songs from Hey Duggee.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: The Mobile Unit learns how things might have been if they hadnt joined the team, by using What-Would-It-Have-Been-Like-Inator helmets.

programme.title: Little J And Big Cuz
programme.desc: Big Cuzs fund-raising sausage sizzle is a slapstick disaster when Old Dog steals the sausages...

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbit is to be given the Queens award for Industry for all the hard work she does. Peppa and her friends accompany Miss Rabbit to the Palace to meet the Queen!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: A game of "Grannies" is fun until Bingo and Bluey cant agree on one simple question: Can Grannies dance? Now they need to video call Nana to get the answer.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: When the Squirrels find Duggee playing saxophone, they want to have a go too. The squirrels make their own musical instruments, playing pots, balloons, tins, water and tubes, but boy are they loud!

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Siblings squabble about who gets to use the garden shed. Can the band settle the argument?

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: We search on behalf of Peter Gunn, a man who has struggled to come to terms with his birth mother giving him up for adoption. And a man desperately searching for the sister who disappeared from his life over 60 years ago.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A tasty sampler of stories from the land - covering food, agriculture, crops, climate, business and innovation - as we meet the fascinating people who make our rural and regional communities unique. Presented by Pip Courtney.

Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Presented by Michael Rowland, with analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, investors, employees and businesses big and small. Presented by Alicia Barry.

Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Presented by Michael Rowland, with analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: This week on The Pacific we dive into the regions enduring love of beauty pageants. Amid the glamour, we also explore the tensions and debates shaping the future of pageantry in the Pacific. (Season Final)

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Ros Childs brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Your daily download of everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs. Patricia Karvelas asks politicians the tough questions and talks to key players and experts on the issues driving the news cycle.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: This week on The Pacific we dive into the regions enduring love of beauty pageants. Amid the glamour, we also explore the tensions and debates shaping the future of pageantry in the Pacific. (Season Final)

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Anthony Albanese has signed a major deal with the US President on critical minerals and secured Trumps support for the AUKUS defence agreement. But the White House meeting wasnt so smooth for US Ambassador Kevin Rudd.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Manny Tsigas presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget Brennan, James Glenday, Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy, Charles Brice and Nate Byrne hear from some of the guests who appeared on News Breakfast. Plus film critic Zak Hepburn and resident foodie Alice Zaslavsky.

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Anthony Albanese has signed a major deal with the US President on critical minerals and secured Trumps support for the AUKUS defence agreement. But the White House meeting wasnt so smooth for US Ambassador Kevin Rudd.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Alicia Barry presents a weekly roundup of business, finance and economic news including the latest trends on Australian and overseas markets, analysing whats going on in the local and global economy and how it affects you.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: After one year of protests against President Vucic, what keeps protesters in Serbia going? Plus how do children in Germany experience a parents cancer diagnosis, and where can they find support?

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Trumps attempt to neuter independent reporting at the Pentagon prompted a press walkout that didnt initially involve one Australian outlet. A podcast bust-up between an ABC star and a co-host tied to Melbournes underworld.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you the days events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.
